0R5CoU0ItBw_xityCDCupw.text: If they actually bother to serve you, the burgers are amazingly good.  I've sampled a fair number of burgers in my time, and these ranked in the top tier.  The potatoes as side dish are OK but nothing special.  French fries would be nice.I went here twice.  The first time my companion and I received immediate and attentive service.  The second time I went alone for a quick bite after work and was unable to get service.  That was unfortunate.Free wi-fi, which is always nice.

jYDG5aOhAeGAzFmPgdAKjA.text: 2 Blur Guys is a relatively new burger shop set up in Orchid Hotel. Its concept is simple - a stripped down quick meal place which serves quality food at reasonable prices. The menu is simple - there's a list of less than 10 burgers to choose from, and each burger comes with a side of potato salad and greens. Portions aren't massive, but they're pretty filling. 2 Blur Guys also serves desserts such as brownies and ice cream. The restaurant is nothing fancy, but it serves as a functional place to grab dinner at with friends.

Oh-IHJ5h2go1vR0IY_DfpQ.text: The burgers were very good. We had the prime beef burgers and they were very juicy. The fries were outstanding although the portions were huge

S0VCx8vQRp__84nSbeJpMA.text: This burger joint is a solid 3.Came here for an early lunch and it was already beginning to get busy as we rolled in.The burger was cooked to medium rare and was quite juicy, and it was a good overall bun-to-pattie ratio, which made for a good experience. I had the prime beef with streaky bacon, which looked to be the best burg on the menu, but unfortunately they snuck some sort of truffle flavour in there (can we stop with that nonsense already???) and there wasn't a good burger sauce to give it a better taste (anything would have helped - BBQ, Tomato, Mustard).So whilst they have the cooking down, they need to work on the construction of the burger somewhat.The handful of wedges was a bit meagre and the wait for the food was on the extreme-side. However as there is only 2 guys, that's probably part of the experience, and with it being Singapore, service is never on the awesome-side.

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Streaky Bacon Burger, 2 Blur Guys

UPvtv1TzNCBZHk1k9xQ6sQ.text: Eat Until "Blur"Oh, the humble hamburger. How it's evolved from a meat patty, melted cheese between a toasted sesame bun to a level that's..... gourmet worthy. We love a good burger bar and was gutted when discovering that Mojo Burps, one of if not our favorite burger joint, had closed. Since than, we've given a few other places a shot without much satisfaction, UNTIL NOW!We decided to do a takeaway because we've seen just how saucy their burgers can get and decided we should do a takeaway to avoid messing ourselves in public. The Wife had the Prime Beef Burger with Foie Gras while I went with a more Non-traditional, smoked salmon burger. Prime Beef with Foie Gras ($24.95)OMG. First the basics. The bun was nicely toasted and thanks to the Foie Gras, the top bun was flavored with the Foie Gras oil, which soaked in every bit of flavour it had to offer. The patty was a spot on. An inch thick patty, well seasoned and perfectly cooked (we had ours medium rare). The patty had a great fat to meat ratio, ensuring that it didn't taste dry or chewy. Consistency of the mince was good as well, avoiding any portion of clumpy meat or overly mushed mince. The results? An extremely juicy patty that constantly dropped juices down the side of our mouths. The Foie Gras was pretty generous, with 2 thick slices, which added richness to the burger. Though not the highest quality of Foie Gras, they were still pretty good. The cheese was perfectly melted while the relish used added a nice sour kick to the burger, helping to cut the richness of the burger. Smoke Salmon Burger ($12.50)I was expecting maybe 6 slices of salmon, max, with tons of avocado. Turns out, it was the complete opposite!The smoked salmon was folded into a one inch thick patty while the avocado was a thin layer between salmon and bun. It was a smoke salmon lovers delight! Only thing I wished was for more avocado and more sauce and you could barely taste it over the salmon. It did need that bit of sourness to help cut the powerful taste of the salmon. Also, it did feel a little strange either smoked salmon between a burger bun, might have been  more "traditional" between a bagel but hey, It still tasted good but I have zero complains with the generosity. Every order also comes as a set, which comes with a drink, salad and awesome wedges with cheese sauce. Hands down for now, this is my favourite burger joint. It may not be the most price friendly restaurant but it's definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore

CIis3z-iBPpAGwAPz4RnLQ.text: Came here with two church mates as one of them wanted to try out burgers for dinner around 7.00 pm on a Saturday. Located walkable distance from Tanjong Pagar MRT and next to famous ramen chains. After exploring the menu, I decided to order Prime Beef with Streaky Bacon. Yes, I am a fan of bacons. And Gruyere cheese sounds unfamiliar. For the beverage, I asked one of the staffs whether the ice lemon tea was homemade and when she answered it was, I ordered that.Price wise here was a bit steep. For the meal, you can either get the wedges for the price listed on the menu or add-on for other side dishes. I decided to try truffle fries with the burger.For the home made ice lemon tea, it is highly recommended. But unfortunately they placed too much ice cubes inside the glass that lost its taste after 20 or so minutes. Could probably ask them for less ice. For the truffle fries, it was good if consumed before 10 minutes. Unfortunately I left them out in the air for long and they turned soggy even though the truffle fries were of thin cuts. For the beef patty, I ordered it medium rare as that is what I normally choose for burgers. Sadly it was not as juicy as other Yelpers had mentioned. The bacon was chewy to my liking and the buns were nicely baked. Store wise, it is not so spacious and could only contain maximum 15 customers. So to avoid the crowds, you might need to come earlier. Portion was reasonable and it did satisfy my hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore

Ene3VGX7COPvd-wfeq3q3A.text: Searched out the menu and was very tempting. Came down and arrived at an almost empty shop ( the ramen stalls round the corner were flooding with people ). One guy came to show us a table, was chill when we wanted another. Was hard to understand his accent when we asked the bestseller. But the taste of the burgers swept us away. Ordered a steak burger and a puller pork burger. Steak burger had superb truffle infused mayonnaise and steak patty (well done) was moist and didn't have the raw taste. Pulled pork reminded me of kong bah (black sauce braised pork). The tenderness draws me in for a bite after another. The lettuce inside was boiled, goes well with the pork instead of conventional salad kinda raw lettuce.Love the crispy potato wedges. Overall it was a very satisfying meal!(:

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Steak burger (bottom) Pulled pork burger (too)

9LiDePtDisr1pWRuaSZ89g.text: OH MYYYY GOD!  This burger is owwzaammmm!  I wonder why I didn't know about this place earlier, tho I came there several time.  The place is quite small, but the ambience is rather nice.  Ordered the #1 Prime Beef Burger & I love how they cook my medium rare beef, it was just perfect and juicy all the way until the last bite! Yum.. every order come with garden green salad and wedges potato topped with gruyere cheese (the type of cheese which I'm not sure how to spell it, but anyway it goes so well with the wedges potatoes :)If you don't like wedges, you can change it with truffle fries (add $2.50) or french fries (add $1.50) - but in my opinion, wedges potato is da'bez!  And come try their homemade ice lemon tea, super fresh and tangy-sweet, such a perfect lemon tea I've ever tried so far! ahahah.And  not forgetting the very friendly staff, who even notice my need before I asked - when the tabasco was finished in our table and I was still pouring the last drop, the staff came to my table and offered me a new bottel of tabasco!  Wow, very very good service!  i am impressed - and stomach is happy!  Will come back and I might try their salmon avocado burger  =D

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Prime beef with ice lemon tea
Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. The prime beef and prime beef with bacon. Wedges potato and truffle fries.

XXl8WwBUODggTScpzle11A.text: I've been introduced to this place a couple and came a couple of times already because I'm drawn to their pulled pork burger. They have nice dessert, but the basic burger is already food for my soul! I've tried a couple of places around this area, but this place still wins hands down. Sure you have to wait a bit, the guys are really trying their best (and they're not slow, mind you) to serve. Friendly staff, and patient (even though my colleague and I took so long to decide on our drink choice).Hope people would give service staff a break with their negativity because a smile to them makes their day too!

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Pulled pork burger with Gruyere cheese

ri_EMbjM2guybU7zBzQSYA.text: I've always walked past this place but have never gone in as the place looked small and cramped. This time, my hungry friends had traipsed down the entire Tanjong Pagar Road on a Friday, and with every establishment full (I kid you not), we ended up here as this was the only place with seats, which isn't always a good sign. We were however pleasantly surprised at the burgers! The beef patties were suitably thick and juicy! Flavorful!! The burgers/patties aren't large, so if you are looking for something substantial, these aren't. nonetheless, these burgers were still satisfying! The portobello one seemed nice (my friend's order) and I would go back to try this one. The truffle fries were good too, although I found the smell to be a little overpowering. Haha! One side note, the salad was a little oily, which was strange. We sat outside, so thankfully it didn't feel cramped. Will go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Portobello Burger!!
Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Drool???

kHZ1COHCwWIGytmX2zWkbg.text: The portobello burger is amazing! The patty was juicy and everything was just so yummy. The place is kinda small and you will smell like burgers after eating there. If you're looking to hang out with a group of friends at the place, try to make a reservation before heading there. Only two guys are working to make and serve the burgers, try to be patient and its definitely worth the wait!

vBzjaQkZYgY_fugtcJqmyQ.text: The best burger in Singapore... where is the six star rating? When I asked for a medium rare burger, I finally got what I had never gotten in this city-state, a medium rare burger. The finishing was perfect, from the bread to the meat to the greens served with it. The fries were amazing too, and the mayo with the fries and the burger was to die for. I'm not one to like mayo very much, but this one, this one is something different. Had a pecan pie for dessert which is quite nice, and the beer selection is quite affordable and varied. I honestly wish I could write more, but I don't want to waste any of your time while you read this review instead of going and having the best burger here. You'll thank me for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. delicious burger and a very nice beer

JzEW6qHEJVp4AXZt_ufigg.text: The bun is good but not grilled inside, the meat is OK but not grilled enough on the outside, the sauce is good but there is too much of it.OK burger ...

7RS_x_LQWKCtNklcPZzZDg.text: Two Blur Guys definitely has the best burger I've tried so far in Singapore.  Back in NYC, this burger would fit right in.It's a small, cozy burger shop, with limited seating and a warm and welcoming staff.  There is one primary waitress and one burger chef.  We noticed that our burgers were made with extreme care, and after we ate, the burger chef was very focused on making sure we enjoyed our burgers.  The burgers come with a small scoop of potato salad and a side salad of greens with a delicious balsamic glaze.We wrapped up the meal with the apple pie, and it was tasty, but I can't help wishing it was served hot with a scoop of apple pie on the side :)PARTING THOUGHT: We'll continue on our Singapore burger quest, but so far, we're quite happy to have found a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Slice of apple crumble
Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Prime beef burger $12.50
Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Prime beef with portobello $16.50

D4RKqj9IOAAHjUP3y0arqg.text: They don't serve water here--only bottled water and an assortment of soft drinks.  My biggest pet-peeve for a restaurant. Oh, that and adding $1 for water. Really, do I need to pay $1 extra for tap water? I'm just borrowing the glass!Other than that, I def. do recommend the burgers here. They're not the big, fat ones at Billy Bombers, but they will fix that burger craving. The beef patties are meaty and seasoned well! I especially fell in love with the balsamic vinaigrette in the side salad, so much that I offered to purchase the bottle off them (They said no :[).Great little joint for some mean (portion-controlled) burgers!

jI5zq69e-v48WQLS4ky_4Q.text: Great burgers, but their patties are frozen.  The waitress was very knowledgable and seems to really love burgers. Feel free to bring outside drinks because they are very hospitable. Best burger next to Tendon! If you don't want to queue for Tendon, this is a great choice

w1FfWC_pwFkBCdCa3q5A9w.text: The burgers here are very good - the beef patties are thick and juicy and the bun is also very good. I had my burger medium well and it came out perfectly cooked, while my wife's was medium and slightly more pink in the middle. Love it when a restaurant knows how to cook their meats.The venue is very small and non-descript. I've walked past this place MANY times without as much noticing it. It looks like a bakery from the outside b/c they display their pies and desserts prominently. There's not much seating so get there during an off hour or do take away. They really need to put a BIG picture of their juicy hamburger on the storefront to attract more folks.We also shared the lemon curd tart which was awesome, worth trying.I only give them 4 stars b/c they do not serve fries and their version of ketchup is a translucent gelatinous pink sweet goo that I couldn't get into. Next time I'll bring fries and ketchup from McDonald's to complement their satisfying burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Huh?

9QuHVsQFueyR68veRNOZ5g.text: For someone who generally stays away from burgers, I really dig the ones here. I ordered the Prime Beef Burger which came with a side of leafy greens and a tiny mountain of potato salad. The beef patty was thick, juicy and well-seasoned. Definitely not fast food material. I saw the cook meticulously grill the beef patty as she toasted the buns, take out the buns and slap on the patty and a slice of gruyère, stick the whole thing back into the oven and finally, keep a watchful eye for the buns to turn a nice golden brown and the cheese to melt just right.The burger here is surely a product of love, love that goes all the way down to my tummy tum tums.

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore. Prime Beef Burger

4pBNl2TlMy-Jmni3sbQlMQ.text: Apart from the other reviews, this small burger bar also does quiches and quick bites to go, which they will heat up for you. The mushroom quiche I got tasted good, but it was a little small and I scoffed it down quickly.I came here on a Friday afternoon around 4pm so it was really empty. Staff were a little bit lacklustre in their service attitude, but otherwise the place looked quite appealing and I wouldn't mind dropping by for a full meal if I'm ever around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Two Blur Guys - Singapore, Singapore

7KuENiDa-o8Qt2EXUB9nrg.text: Order the burger without relish and mayo. Otherwise the burger is disgusting. Without those two, a medium burger tastes legit.

ZaJ5l48Ya1AKBoPIdl871A.text: I came here today for a spur of the moment lunch plan with a friend. As soon as we walked in we were seated. Unfortunately, it was in a cramped little corner. We ordered our food and though it came rather quickly, I wouldn't say it was the best. It was overloaded with truffle mayo and the meat was two soft and crumbled out of the burger. The bread ended up getting soggy because how juicy the burger was. All in all... I have a coupon for this place from pickatsg but I don't think I'll be using it. #disappointed

mv0Le_B82uuTtjmzxvxTAg.text: With just four tables in a tiny space, Two Blur Guys isn't trying very hard perhaps in this newly competitive Duxton/Tanjong Pagar area (Soooo many good things to eat around here), but maybe it doesn't have to. I come to Duxton a lot and frequently walk over to the Orchid Hotel to eat at Teppei or Tonkotsu King. So I was pleasantly surprised to see this tiny space along the Tanjong Pagar stretch.I wish they did more marketing, or maybe it's good that they didn't, because when I started to hear friends excitedly discuss the burgers and desserts here I was intrigued enough to go check it out. There's a small selection of interesting (mostly Aussie) beers and wines, and the cakes and tarts like the Lamington are good.Alas I have been too full from ramen usually to ever eat a full meal here, but I'm going to check out the burgers next time especially now that I've found out that Singapore's elusive food extraordinaire Jimmy Chok is involved here in some way or other.
